page.title: 19NATURE RESERVE ON ARNE
page.content: The stumps of cleared rhododendrons can be seen along the trail,and mature plants line the path.The trail eventually leads to a hide set up by the RSPB which overlooks the saltmarsh, estuary,and sandbanks. Bird-identification charts are present for part-time birdwatchers! The trail returns to the starting point through more rhododendron stumps, evidence of the hard work of volunteer bird watchers and then through coniferous woodland.The gravel track back to the car park leads through farmland(mainly arable and improved pasture),until it joins the main road in the village of Arne.The car park costs 20p,collected on the trust of the motorist in a seed tray. It will soon have a toilet,a rare amenity for the Arne Peninsula.
